results.title: Antarctic Pioneers
results.creator_credit: Frank Hurley, Phillip Garth Law, Frank Bagnall, Maslyn Williams and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: One of Australia’s most famous photographers and explorers, Frank Hurley, presents this absorbing film on the history of Australia’s first expeditions to the Antarctic continent between 1911 and 1954. It includes remarkable, original footage of the expedition on the tall ship Aurora in 1911, the Campbell expedition in 1947 and the Law expedition in 1954. Much of this film was made by Hurley when he accompanied Sir Douglas Mawson and an Australian party to the Antarctic in 1912 and on later expeditions. The program traces the history of the Australian expeditions between 1911 and 1914 and the establishment of Mawson Station. A rare film which reveals the true hardship and courage of these early pioneers.

results.title: Spinning with Dianna
results.brief_description: Dianna takes the beginners through each process from combing, spinning, plying, winding and washing of the yarn ready for use in varied garments.

results.title: Peter Grimes
results.creator_credit: John Tooley, John Vernon, Elijah Moshinsky, BBC-TV and Covent Garden Video Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Grimes, the opera by Benjamin Britten, libretto by Montagu, directed by Sir John Tooley is based on George Crabbe’s long narrative poem, “The Borough”, and is set on the East Coast of England in a small fishing community dominated by the sea. The theme is universal - conflict between an individual and a society that sees him as an outsider. Features performers Jon Vickers (Peter Grimes), Heather Harper (Ellen Oxford), Norman Bailey (Captain Balstrode), The Royal Opera Chorus and the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Sir Colin Davis. Recorded at The Royal Opera House, Covent Garden.

results.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
results.brief_description: James Stewart stars as naive young Jefferson Smith, the well-loved head of a chain of boys’ clubs, who is unwittingly set up by a group of unscrupulous politicians and sent to Washington as a Senator. He is expected to vote as the party machine dictates and so ease the passage of a fraudulent Bill. Jeff discovers the double-deal and the normally mild mannered good guy turns into a veritable “house on fire” to attack the web of corruption that surrounds him.

results.title: The Day of the Triffids
results.brief_description: The few who retain their eyesight are horrified to see the Triffids normally small plants - grow to huge proportions as they become affected by the presence of the mysterious meteorites. As the Triffids multiply by the millions, they begin a march on civilisation, brutally destroying everyone in their path. Based on the book by John Wyndham. Rated: PG

results.title: The Stranger
results.brief_description: An escaped Nazi criminal marries an American woman and settles in a Connecticut village. A highly convincing melodrama - enhanced by directorial touches, splendid photography and no-holds barred climax, involving a church clock.

results.title: A Tale of Two Cities
results.creator_credit: Jack Conway and David O. Selznick
results.brief_description: Based on Charles Dickens great novel, “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of turbulent times - the French revolution, recreated in breathtaking scale and painstaking detail. And it is a timeless tale - the story of two men in love with the same woman. Ronald Colman stars in what is perceived as the best role he ever played. “A Tale of Two Cities” is a tale of romance and revolution, politics and passion, but most of all it is a true classic for all time.

results.title: Basic Sewing Skills for Stretch Knits
results.brief_description: Hosted by Paula Duncan, this Woman’s Day program will provide you with all of the necessary basic information on stretch knit sewing. Armed with the basics you will then be able to make garments ranging from loose fitting T-shirts to after-five frocks.

results.title: Elton John live in Australia. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: This concert, on December 14th 1986, before 11,000 people in the Sydney Entertainment Centre, was the last in the “Tour de Force”, a series of 27 performances covering all of Australia. This video is of the first half of the show which featured Elton and his 13 piece band. The whole show was also being televised live, via satellite, to an estimated audience of over 10 million people. Rated: G

results.title: Monterey pop
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, John Phillips and Lou Adler
results.brief_description: In June 1967, the Mamas and the Papas hosted a three day Pop Festival in Monterey, California. D.A. Pennebaker’s outstanding film is a record of extraordinary musicians and extraordinary insight into an era. This is the 60’s in celebration, exploding with new voices and optimistic energy. Performing artists include Janis Joplin, Otis Redding, Jimi Hendrix, Jefferson Airplane, Simon and Garfunkel, Scott McKenzie, Eric Burdon and the Animals, Canned Heat and The Who.
